column4: if i have the linux 2.6.15 source and want to compile one module to use in my 2.6.12 kernel - how would i do it?
you would download the 2.6.12 source, make menuconfig...import the config from your current kernel...and then enable said module
the module i need is only in the 2.6.15 kernel...
then you'll need to upgrade your kernel
there is no way to use that module with the older kernel?
you'll need to go to the new source, make menuconfig, then import the old config and enable the new module
there are ways, but they are unreliable at best
also...if its a distro-supplied kernel...cross-versioning modules is probably not enabled
